tags.name: Account Details
tags.description: Use Account Detail APIs to retrieve information associated with an accountId.

tags.name: Account Transactions
tags.description: An account is a collection of information used to maintain and track balances and financial activity. Transaction history is logged and associated with each account.

tags.name: Account Balance
tags.description: An account is a collection of information used to maintain and track balances and financial activity. Transaction history is logged and associated with each account.

tags.name: Account Order Detail
tags.description:
Use Account Order Detail APIs to retrieve information associated with an individual card order or multiple card orders.

Order statuses:
• NOT_APPLICABLE - Not used today.
• ORDER_PENDING - Physical card order is pending, waiting to be picked up in the Card Vendor File.
• ORDER_SUBMITTED - Physical card order is in the Card Vendor File and sent to the card vendor.
• ORDER_CONFIRMED_AND_COMPLETE - Card vendor sent DPS Forward acknowledgement that the order sent in the Card Vendor File was accepted. Issued digital cards also receive this status.
• ORDER_REJECTED - Card vendor sent DPS Forward acknowledgement that the order sent in the Card Vendor File was not accepted. You should review the order, update any errors, and initiate a new card request.
• ORDER_ONHOLD - A card request is placed on hold due to the sanctions screening process (if applicable).
• ORDER_CANCELLED - Card request is cancelled due to the sanctions screening process (if applicable).

tags.name: Account Status
tags.description:
Each account has its own status not related to card status.

Account status governs what actions can be performed on an account.

Valid account statuses are as follows:
• ACTIVE - Account is active.
• ADMIN_SUSPENDED - Client has suspended the account.
• PENDING_ACCOUNT_CLOSURE - Cardholder has initiated the closure process and no net new transactions will be allowed on this account. If a cardholder has pending transactions, the account remains in this status until the transactions clear.
• CLOSED - Account is permanently closed.

See Account and Profile Management.

tags.name: Authorization Hold
tags.description:
Cardholders might want to remove a transaction hold prior to the normal age-off process. For example, if a cardholder returns a purchase and is issued a refund, the amount of the purchase is still held for some period of time, typically three days. In order to increase their available balance prior to the normal age-off process, cardholders can request to remove a hold.

You should pay careful attention to the inherent risks in removing a hold. Releasing the hold on a transaction that has not been properly vetted can expose you to unrecoverable financial losses.

tags.name: Authorization Stand In
tags.description: Use the authorization stand-in APIs to retrieve and update Stand-In Processing (STIP) status. DPS Forward can stand in for any planned outages or maintenance events and authorize transactions on your behalf.

tags.name: Card Activation
tags.description:
Cards can be activated using either:

• The cardId, the last 4 digits of the card number, and the expiration date
• The full card number plus expiration date (you must be PCI compliant)

tags.name: Card CVV2
tags.description:
Use the Generate CVV2 for a Card APIs to generate a card verification value 2 (CVV2) for the current card. The CVV2 is derived from the cardId and expiration date provided in the request.

CVV2 values are never stored in the system. When using these APIs, the CVV2 value is immediately calculated using an algorithm based on the card number and expiration date, or the cardId, the last4PrimaryAccountNumber, and the expiration date. If the expiration date entered in the request is incorrect, the CVV2 that is generated will be incorrect.

Common applications for this functionality include:
• Displaying the CVV2 values to cardholders for digital representation of a card.
• Using CVV2 to validate cardholders in the activation flow.

MLE: Required

tags.name: Card Details
tags.description: Use Card Detail APIs to retrieve information associated with a cardId, and to lookup card number and cardId.

tags.name: Card Enrollment
tags.description:
Use Card Enrollment APIs to issue a card or add a card to an existing account. Card form types are:

• DIGITAL – Provides an instantly issued digital card.
• PHYSICAL – Provides a physical card.
• DIGITAL_PHYSICAL – Provides an instantly issued temporary digital card to use while physical card is in-flight. The same card number is always assigned to both the digital and physical card.

Digital cards are issued active. Physical cards are issued inactive.

For more information, see Card Management.

tags.name: Card Order Detail
tags.description:
Use Card Order Detail APIs to retrieve information associated with an individual card order or multiple card orders.

Order statuses:

• NOT_APPLICABLE - Not used today
• ORDER_PENDING - Physical card order is pending, waiting to be picked up in the Card Vendor File.
• ORDER_SUBMITTED - Physical card order is in the Card Vendor File and sent to the card vendor.
• ORDER_CONFIRMED_AND_COMPLETE - Card vendor sent DPS Forward acknowledgement that the order sent in the Card Vendor File was accepted. Issued digital cards also receive this status.
• ORDER_REJECTED - Card vendor sent DPS Forward acknowledgement that the order sent in the Card Vendor File was not accepted. You should review the order, update any errors, and initiate a new card request.
• ORDER_ONHOLD - A card request is placed on hold due to the sanctions screening process (if applicable).
• ORDER_CANCELLED - Card request is cancelled due to the sanctions screening process (if applicable).

tags.name: Card Order Management
tags.description: The process of logging undeliverable cards is used to remove cards from circulation that were not received by the cardholder. Undeliverable cards should be physically destroyed to prevent further use.

tags.name: Card PIN Management
tags.description:
Card PIN Management APIs enable cardholders to set a personal identification number (PIN), and request PIN mailers. PINs are four-digit numbers used to authenticate the cardholder for some transaction types, or at automated teller machines (ATMs) when cardholders access banking services.

If the card program supports PINs, DPS provides a system-generated PIN.

tags.name: Card Replacement
tags.description:
If a card needs to be replaced, cardholders must request a replacement card to restore access to their account.

Digital cards are issued active. Physical cards are issued inactive.

tags.name: Card Status
tags.description:
Each card has its own status not related to account status.

Card status governs what actions can be performed on a card. See Card Management for a list of card status rules.

Valid card statuses are as follows:

• PENDING_ACTIVATION - Status given to a new or reissued physical card prior to activation.
• ACTIVE - Status given to a card that has been activated and is ready for use.
• SUSPENDED - Status given to a card that prevents the card from being used but does not close it.
• LOST_STOLEN - Status given to a card when the card has been reported lost or stolen.
• CLOSED - Status given to a card when the card has been closed.
• EXPIRED - System-generated only status given to a card when the card has reached its expiration date.
• RETURNED_UNDELIVERABLE - Status given to a card that has been sent back to the return address or was never delivered to the cardholder.
ADMIN_SUSPENDED – Status given to a card that prevents the card from being used but does not close it.

tags.name: Custodian Services
tags.description: Use the Custodian Services APIs to register your custodians, define a BIN range and associate it to your custodian, and to retrieve custodian details.

tags.name: Migration
tags.description:
Migration services enable you to migrate cards, accounts, and profiles from your system to DPS Forward.

When provided, the following data accompanies any migrated card:
• Account information – Available balance, ledger balance, account number, and routing number (subject to balance maximum and minimums)
• Current card details
• In-flight card details (needed to enable card activation)
• Previous card details (needed to map any transaction events that occurred with the previous card to the appropriate cardId)
• Cardholder profile data

The Migrate data to Forward API:
• Creates the card, account, and profile record for each request.
• Sets the Card Status, Account Status, and Account Balances to the values in the request. Accounts statused as Closed cannot be migrated.

Important: This API does not support migration of transaction-related data.

tags.name: Profile Management
tags.description: Use Profile Management APIs to retrieve and update information associated with a profileId.

tags.name: Program Services
tags.description:
The Wire Confirmation Report contains the net totals of your daily wire transfer amount. These totals are needed to satisfy your daily settlement obligation. The Wire Confirmation Report is only available for U.S.-based card programs and for the networks that participate in single point settlement.

With this report you can:
• Validate settlement with Visa DPS
• Reconcile your daily settlement wire activity
• Verify Wire Confirmation totals

Activity for Friday, 8:00 a.m. MT through Monday, 8:00 a.m. MT is included in Monday’s settlement. Banking holidays are rolled into the next banking business day’s wire transfer. The baseline retention timeframe for data is 6 months and 2 years.

tags.name: Token Services
tags.description: These APIs enable you to retrieve tokens associated with a PAN or cardId, and manage their life cycles.

tags.name: Transaction Services
tags.description: Transaction Services APIs enable you to search and inquire on network transactions.

tags.name: Transaction Simulator
tags.description:
Use the Transaction Simulator APIs to emulate e-commerce transactions transmitted via ISO 20022 messages in a certification environment using your own data. The messages are sent to the transaction management endpoints you have set up on your system.

These APIs allow you to:
• Generate authorization and clearing ecommerce-specific transactions
• Ready yourself for transaction authorizations and clearings in a live production environment
• Verify that your system correctly responds to the simulated transaction request
• Understand how the data contained in a request maps to the ISO 20022 response

post.description:
This API enables you to flag in-flight physical cards that were undelivered to the intended cardholder. Cards flagged as RETURNED_UNDELIVERED cannot be activated. If the returned card was for a valid cardholder account and profile, that cardholder must be issued a new, replacement card.
The replacement card will have a different card number, expiration date, and CVV2 than the one that was undelivered.

MLE: Mandatory

parameters.name: correlation-id
parameters.description: Unique ID provided by caller that correlates to a specific message transmission. Used to easily find a message in the logs.

get.description:
This API enables you to retrieve all card orders associated with a specific cardId.

The status returned in the response is for the card order status, not the current card status.

Profile information included in the response is current as of the date of the order, and does not include updates or changes made since the order date.

If you need order history at the account level, use the Retrieve Order Details by accountId API or the Retrieve Order Details by accountId and orderId API.

MLE: Mandatory

parameters.name: correlation-id
parameters.description: Unique ID provided by caller that correlates to a specific message transmission. Used to easily find a message in the logs.

parameters.name: cardId
parameters.description: Unique ID for current card. minLength: 1, maxLength: 50.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Index of starting point in result set. Page starts at 1.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of records returned on a page. minLimit: > 1, maxLimit: 100.

parameters.name: showFullPan
parameters.description: This query parameter defines whether the response will have full or masked PAN

get.summary: Retrieve Order Details by cardId and orderId
get.description:
This API enables you to retrieve card order details associated with a specific cardId and orderId.

The status returned in the response is for the card order status, not the current card status.

Profile information included in the response is current as of the date of the order, and does not include updates or changes made since the order date.

If you need order history at the account level, use the Retrieve Order Details by accountId API or the Retrieve Order Details by accountId and orderId API.

MLE: Mandatory

parameters.description: Unique ID provided by caller that correlates to a specific message transmission. Used to easily find a message in the logs.

parameters.name: cardId

parameters.description: Unique ID for card order

post.description:
This API enables you to register your custodians on DPS Forward by adding the custodian’s name and, optionally, their default support number. The response returns a custodianId, which is used in the Enroll a Card API request (with the programId) to issue a card in the extended BIN ranges associated with a particular custodian.

The defaultSupportNumber is the token service call center number defined at the custodian level and used during step-up authentication (yellow-path). This phone number is used unless a supportNumber is defined at the BIN range level in the Create Extended BIN Ranges API. If defaultSupportNumber and supportNumber are left blank, the phone number defined at your program level will be used.

After you register your custodian using the Create Custodian API, use the Create Extended BIN Ranges API to define an extended BIN range and associate it to your custodian.

MLE: Optional

parameters.name: correlation-id
parameters.description: Unique ID provided by caller that correlates to a specific message transmission. Used to easily find a message in the logs.

post.description:
This API enables you to define a BIN range and associate it to your custodian. You can extend BIN ranges up to nine (9) digits. For each custodian, PANs are generated within their assigned extended BIN ranges. Custodians can participate in multiple programs (programId) using the same custodianId. As the reseller, you designate what program the custodian is participating in based on the extended BIN ranges included in the request.

The supportNumber is the token service call center number defined at the custodian extended-BIN-range level and is used during step-up authentication (yellow-path). If left blank, the defaultSupportNumber, defined in the Create Custodian API, will be used. PANs are generated and available for issuance 1 hour after the API request is sent.

Important: It is critical that you accurately define extended BIN ranges in this API. Extended BIN ranges submitted in the request are finalized and cannot be modified.

MLE: Optional

parameters.name: correlation-id
parameters.description: Unique ID provided by caller that correlates to a specific message transmission. Used to easily find a message in the logs.

parameters.name: custodianId
parameters.description: The GUID representing the custodian.

get.description:
This API enables you to retrieve custodian name, default support number, and all extended BIN ranges associated to a custodian. The extendedBinRanges object includes the programId, supportNumber, and extendedBinDescription, along with the extendedLowBin, and extendedHighBin values.

MLE: Mandatory

parameters.name: custodianId
parameters.description: The GUID representing the custodian.

parameters.name: correlation-id
parameters.description: Unique ID provided by caller that correlates to a specific message transmission. Used to easily find a message in the logs.

put.description:
This API enables you to set a PIN for a specified card via cardId. 

If service providers support offline PINs and a replacement card is requested and requires a new PIN, the PIN change request should be completed prior to the replacement card being requested.

If the PIN change request is completed after the replacement card has been requested, the offline PIN must be synchronized. 

MLE: Mandatory

parameters.name: correlation-id
parameters.description: Unique ID provided by caller that correlates to a specific message transmission. Used to easily find a message in the logs.

parameters.name: cardId
parameters.description: Unique ID for current card. minLength: 1, maxLength: 50.

post.description:
This API enables you to request individual PIN mailers if supported by the card program and card vendor. A PIN mailer is a physical document mailed to the cardholder that contains the PIN assigned to a card. PIN mailers are sent to cardholders when new cards are issued or when replacing a card that needs a new PIN.

If shipping address is not included, the cardholder’s profile address is used. If shipping method is not included, the default shipping method configured at the card program level is used.

The API includes an option to assign a new system-generated PIN. If a card program supports PINs and a replacement card is requested and requires a new PIN, the PIN mailer with the new PIN should be requested prior to card replacement request. Following the steps in this order ensures PIN on the card matches the PIN contained in the PIN mailer.

Steps:
• Request PIN mailer with a new PIN (Request PIN Mailer API)
• Request replacement card (Replace a Card API)

MLE: Optional

parameters.name: cardId
parameters.description: Unique ID for current card. minLength: 1, maxLength: 50.

parameters.name: correlation-id
parameters.description: Unique ID provided by caller that correlates to a specific message transmission. Used to easily find a message in the logs.

patch.description:
Use the Update Card Preferences API to change card preferences using the cardId.

This API enables you to provide your cardholders the ability to opt a card in or out of the Visa Account Updater (VAU) service.

If you participate in the Visa Account Updater (VAU) service, cards are opted into VAU by default when they are issued to the cardholder. A cardholder can opt out and opt back into the VAU service with the merchantCredentialUpdate field. The selections made with the merchantCredentialUpdate field do not permanently opt in or opt out a card; however, the value persists until it is changed. If you want to block a specific card update from being sent to VAU, regardless of the cardholder’s VAU opt-in preference, use the ISSUER_BLOCK in the merchantCredentialUpdate field in the Activate a Card and Replace a Card APIs.

parameters.name: correlation-id
parameters.description: Unique ID provided by caller that correlates to a specific message transmission. Used to easily find a message in the logs.

parameters.name: cardId
parameters.description: Unique ID for current card. minLength: 1, maxLength: 50.

post.summary: Add a New Card to an Account
post.description:
This API enables you to add additional cards to an existing account. Additional cards can be added for the account holder using their existing profileId. Account holders can also add different cardholders to their account by entering those cardholders' profile information into the profile object. Profile entity or profileId must be provided.

New cardholders receive a new cardId and profileId associated to the existing accountId in the response.

The expiration date defaults to your configurations for card lifecycle unless explicitly specified in the request. If cardStockId, cardVendorId, collateralId, and shippingMethod fields are left blank, this API uses the default values you set during onboarding.

If a card program is configured to support PINs, cardholders can set a PIN when they add a card. If cardholders do not set a PIN, DPS Forward creates a system-generated PIN.

MLE: Mandatory

parameters.name: correlation-id
parameters.description: Unique ID provided by caller that correlates to a specific message transmission. Used to easily find a message in the logs.

parameters.name: accountId
parameters.description: Unique ID for account. minLength: 1, maxLength: 50.

parameters.name: showFullPan
parameters.description: This query parameter defines whether the response will have full or masked PAN

post.description: The expiration date defaults to your configurations for card lifecycle unless specified in the request. If cardStockId, cardVendorId, and collateralId fields are left blank, this API uses the default values set during onboarding. If the shippingMethod field is left blank, the API uses the standard shipping method.

post.description:
This API enables you to issue a card for a specific card program using an assigned programId. Details in the request populate the card, account, and profile records upon enrollment. The cardId, accountId, and profileId generated in the response are used for subsequent interactions with DPS Forward APIs.

Profile entity or profileId must be provided. Existing cardholders can enroll in different card programs by passing their existing profileId.

The expiration date defaults to your configurations for card lifecycle unless specified in the request. If cardStockId, cardVendorId, collateralId, and shippingMethod fields are left blank, this API uses the default values set during onboarding.

If a card program is configured to support PINs, cardholders can set a PIN upon enrollment. If cardholders do not set a PIN, DPS Forward creates a system-generated PIN.

To add an additional card to an existing account, use the Add a New Card to an Account API.

MLE: Mandatory

parameters.name: correlation-id
parameters.description: Unique ID provided by caller that correlates to a specific message transmission. Used to easily find a message in the logs.

parameters.name: programId
parameters.description: GUID. Unique ID for a client configuration in the Visa system. minLength: 1, maxLength: 40.

parameters.name: showFullPan
parameters.description: This query parameter defines whether the response will have full or masked PAN

post.summary: Add a New Card to an Account
post.description:
This API enables you to add additional cards to an existing account. Additional cards can be added for the account holder using their existing profileId. Account holders can also add different cardholders to their account by entering those cardholders' profile information into the profile object. Profile entity or profileId must be provided.

New cardholders receive a new cardId and profileId associated to the existing accountId in the response.

The expiration date defaults to your configurations for card lifecycle unless explicitly specified in the request. If cardStockId, cardVendorId, and collateralId fields are left blank, this API uses the default values you set during onboarding. If the shippingMethod field is left blank, the API uses the standard shipping method.

If a card program is configured to support PINs, cardholders can set a PIN when they add a card. If cardholders do not set a PIN, DPS Forward creates a system-generated PIN.

MLE: Mandatory

get.description:
This API enables you to retrieve transaction details using the processorTransactionId. This API returns the complete ISO 20022 payload for a specific transaction. You can retrieve a transaction that has occurred within the last 90 days.

MLE: Mandatory

parameters.name: processorTransactionId
parameters.description: Unique transaction ID, generated by Forward. DPS_Processor_ID for every event in the transaction. One LifeCycleTraceIdentificationData can have multiple ProcessorTransactionIds.

parameters.name: showFullPan
parameters.description: This query parameter defines whether the response will have full or masked PAN

parameters.name: X-Channel-Id
parameters.description: Id that uniquely identifies a request channel.

parameters.name: X-Correlation-Id
parameters.description: Unique ID provided by caller that correlates to a specific message transmission. Used to easily find a message in the logs.

post.summary: Retrieve Transactions Based on Search Criteria
post.description:
This API enables you to search for a list of network transactions.

You can search for transactions in 30-day increments and retrieve transactions that have occurred within the last 90 days.

Responses in this API include a subset of the full payload for each transaction.

To retrieve detailed transaction information, use the processorTransactionId returned by this API (included in the cardIssrRefData field in the response), in the Retrieve Transaction Details API to get the complete ISO 20022 message.

MLE: Mandatory

parameters.name: X-Correlation-Id
parameters.description: Unique ID provided by caller that correlates to a specific message transmission. Used to easily find a message in the logs.

parameters.name: X-Channel-Id
parameters.description: Id that uniquely identifies a request channel.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Index of starting point in result set. The most recent transaction is listed first. If you want to receive a different subset of transactions, you can request any number greater than 0 to be the starting point. Defaults to 1 if not provided.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of records returned starting with the offset number and going back historically (up to 2 years). Defaults to 10 if not provided.

parameters.name: startDate
parameters.description:
Start time is the start of that date.   The value is in UTC and the format is yyyy-MM-dd'T'hh:mm:ss.SSS'Z'.
Example: 2020-09-13T23:30:52.123Z

parameters.name: endDate
parameters.description:
End date for range of transactions. 
The value is in UTC and the format is yyyy-MM-dd'T'hh:mm:ss.SSS'Z'.

parameters.name: showFullPan
parameters.description: This query parameter defines whether the response will have full or masked PAN

put.description:
This API enables you to change the card status of the current card to LOST_STOLEN, CLOSED, ACTIVE, SUSPENDED, or ADMIN_SUSPENDED. See the Card Management for allowable status transitions.

This API is not used to activate a card. Use the Activate a Card API to activate an issued physical card.

This API is not used to change the status of an in-flight card to RETURNED_UNDELIVERED. Use the Mark Physical Card as Undelivered API to change card status to RETURNED_UNDELIVERED.

Card statuses are separate from account statuses. Cardholders can change card status without impacting the associated account. If a cardholder has multiple cards associated to an account, changing the status of one card will not impact the status of other cards.

MLE: Optional

parameters.name: correlation-id
parameters.description: Unique ID provided by caller that correlates to a specific message transmission. Used to easily find a message in the logs.

parameters.name: cardId
parameters.description: Unique ID for current card. minLength: 1, maxLength: 50.

get.description:
This API enables you to get transaction history associated with a specific account using the accountId.

You can search up to a 2-year time period using startDate and endDate fields. If no dates or only one date is provided in the request, then the results will default to the last 30 days.

If no status is defined in the request, the response returns transactions that have a status of Pending and Posted.

Results are sorted by status, then date and time of initial authorization from newest to oldest. Pending transactions always appear first in the response with the most recent transaction first.

MLE: Optional

parameters.name: correlation-id
parameters.description: Unique ID provided by caller that correlates to a specific message transmission. Used to easily find a message in the logs.

parameters.name: accountId
parameters.description: Unique ID for account. minLength: 1, maxLength: 50.

parameters.name: startDate
parameters.description: Start date in  YYYY-MM-DD format. Start time is the start of that date. The value is in UTC and the format is yyyy-MM-dd'T'hh:mm:ss.SSS'Z'. Example: 2020-09-13T23:30:52.123Z.

parameters.name: endDate
parameters.description: End date for range of transactions. The value is in UTC and the format is yyyy-MM-dd'T'hh:mm:ss.SSS'Z'.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Index of starting point in result set. Page starts at 1.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of records returned on a page. minLimit: > 1, maxLimit: 100.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Returns the transaction with requested status.Possible values : PENDING, POSTED, AUTHORIZED, DECLINED

post.description:
This API enables you to migrate card, account, and profile data from an existing BIN processed on a different platform.

A card cannot be linked to multiple profiles. Current card details are required. If a new cardholder only has an in-flight card, the in-flight card details must be populated in the current card details object. Previous card details support zero or more primary account numbers.

To migrate multiple cards linked to a single profile, include multiple card items in the linkedCards array. Migrating multiple cards with different profiles for an account can be accomplished through the migrationData array.

To migrate additional cards to an account already on DPS Forward, include the associated accountId in the request. If the additional migrated card is linked to a profile that is already associated with the account, pass the associated profileId in place of the profile object. The card number being migrated must not already exist on DPS Forward.

MLE: Mandatory

parameters.name: correlation-id
parameters.description: Unique ID provided by caller that correlates to a specific message transmission. Used to easily find a message in the logs.

parameters.name: programId
parameters.description: GUID. Unique ID for a client configuration in the Visa system. minLength: 1, maxLength: 40.

post.summary: Migrate a card to Forward - Deprecated

post.summary: Activate a Card using Card Number
post.description:
This API enables you to activate a first-issued, replacement, or reissued card using the full card number and the expiration date. If you activate a card, it becomes your current card and is available for use.

If you are configured for tokenization and VTS PAN Lifecycle Service, when you activate a reissued or replacement card, DPS Forward will update the token’s credentials in Visa Token Service (VTS) with the new card number and/or expiration date.

MLE: Mandatory

parameters.name: correlation-id
parameters.description: Unique ID provided by caller that correlates to a specific message transmission. Used to easily find a message in the logs.

post.description:
This API enables you to activate a first-issued, replacement, or reissued physical card using a given cardId, last 4 digits of the card number and expiration date. If you activate a card, it becomes your current card and is available for use.

If you are configured for tokenization and you are activating a reissued or replacement card, DPS Forward will update the token’s credentials in Visa Token Service (VTS) with the new card number and expiration date.

MLE: Mandatory

parameters.name: correlation-id
parameters.description: Unique ID provided by caller that correlates to a specific message transmission. Used to easily find a message in the logs.

parameters.name: cardId
parameters.description: Unique ID for current card. minLength: 1, maxLength: 50.

post.description:
This API enables you to emulate network authorizations to independently develop and test cooperative authorization from DPS Forward. This API allows you to send a request containing an authorization amount for an e-commerce transaction and validate that the data returned in the ISO 20022 message response conforms to the parameters in the request.

MLE: Mandatory

parameters.name: correlation-id
parameters.description: Unique ID provided by caller that correlates to a specific message transmission. Used to easily find a message in the logs.

post.description:
This API enables you to emulate network clearings to independently develop and test cooperative authorization from DPS Forward. This API allows you to send a request containing a clearing amount and validate that the data returned in the ISO 20022 message response conforms to the parameters in the request.

The request must contain details of the previous authorization obtained with the Simulate Network Transaction for Authorizations API.

You can simulate multiple clearings using sequenceCount and sequenceNumber fields.

All other fields not included in the request are either defaulted or carried forward from the original authorization.

MLE: Mandatory

parameters.name: correlation-id
parameters.description: Unique ID provided by caller that correlates to a specific message transmission. Used to easily find a message in the logs.

get.description:
This API enables you to determine if you are currently in STIP.

MLE: Optional

parameters.name: correlation-id
parameters.description: Unique ID provided by caller that correlates to a specific message transmission. Used to easily find a message in the logs.

parameters.name: user-id
parameters.description: Unique ID for user.

put.description:
This API enables you to invoke and revoke STIP. When STIP status has been updated to ON, DPS Forward stands in on your behalf to process transactions. When STIP status has been updated to OFF, DPS Forward stops stand-in processing.

MLE: Optional

parameters.name: user-id
parameters.description: Unique ID for user.

parameters.name: correlation-id
parameters.description: Unique ID provided by caller that correlates to a specific message transmission. Used to easily find a message in the logs.

get.description:
This API enables you to retrieve card details. Responses include details associated with the "current card" and also return the order details for the "in-flight card" (if applicable).

If a cardId is associated with an active digital card and an in-flight physical card request, the API returns the digital card details since it is considered the active current card. The in-flight card order details for the physical card are also returned in the orderDetails object. Digital card details will no longer be returned once the physical card is activated.

See Learn More for information about cardId and current card.

MLE: Mandatory

parameters.name: correlation-id
parameters.description: Unique ID provided by caller that correlates to a specific message transmission. Used to easily find a message in the logs.

parameters.name: cardId
parameters.description: Unique ID for current card. minLength: 1, maxLength: 50.

parameters.name: showFullPan
parameters.description: This query parameter defines whether the response will have full or masked PAN

get.description:
This API enables you to retrieve the history of actions performed on a card using the cardId. Users can opt to return all activity or restrict the results to a particular action type and/or date range.

MLE: Mandatory

parameters.name: correlation-id
parameters.description: Unique ID provided by caller that correlates to a specific message transmission. Used to easily find a message in the logs.

parameters.name: cardId
parameters.description: Unique ID for current card. minLength: 1, maxLength: 50.

parameters.name: startDate
parameters.description: Start date in  YYYY-MM-DD format. Start time is the start of that date. The value is in UTC and the format is yyyy-MM-dd'T'hh:mm:ss.SSS'Z'. Example: 2020-09-13T23:30:52.123Z.

parameters.name: endDate
parameters.description: End date for range of transactions. The value is in UTC and the format is yyyy-MM-dd'T'hh:mm:ss.SSS'Z'.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Index of starting point in result set. Page starts at 1.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of records returned on a page. minLimit: > 1, maxLimit: 100.

parameters.name: actionTypes
parameters.description:
Returns the card history with requested action types. Examples: 
PinValidationOperation,
CardBlockedOnlineTransactionLimitThresholdTriggered,
UnableToSendPinSyncScriptInTransactionResponseDueToMissingChipDataTransactionRef,
PinSyncScriptFailedOrWasNotExecutedPinSyncScriptWillBeResentLast4Of,
PinSyncScriptSuccessfullyExecutedForALast4Of,
PinTryExceededOfflinePinIsBlocked,
OfflinePinStatusUpdatedToSelectedBasedOnTransactionData,
PinChangeNotAllowedHolderIsDeceased,
PinChangeNotAllowedstatusNotCompatibleWithPinChangeOperation,
PinChangeNotAllowedPinChangeAttemptsThresholdHasBeenReachedOrExceeded,
PinSelectionNotAllowedstatusNotCompatibleWithPinSelectionOperation,
PinSelectionNotAllowedHolderIsDeceased,
OfflinePinUnblockPerformed,
OfflinePinUnblockReversed,
PinChangePerformed,
PinChangeReversed,
CardStatusUpdate,
OneTimePasswordVerified,
OneTimePasswordVerificationSendFailure,
ConsumerCardPurchase,
DefaultPinCreate,
RequestForPinMailer,
PinChangeOperation,
OneTimePasswordVerificationMethod,
AutoReissuedCard,
CardOrderStatusUpdate,
UndeliveredCardCurrent,
UndeliveredCardReplacement,
CardActivationSuccess,
CardActivationFailure,
CardActivationExceededMaxAttempts,
TokenPanUpdateSuccess,
TokenPanUpdateFailure,
CardMigrated,
CardIdLookupByPan,
CardIdAndTransactionEligibilityLookupByPan,
CardPurchaseOrderStatus,
CardReplacement,
PinSelectPerformed,
PreferenceChange

post.description:
This API enables you to retrieve a card number using the cardId. The card number in the response will be encrypted with a public/private key pair (e2ee) thereby eliminating any requirements to store or transmit the card number on the client system. This API is for service providers who do not store card numbers but need to access a card number.

This API retrieves just the card number without other card details.

Example use case:

Service providers want to display full card number for digital card in mobile app that is secured all the way to the device.

MLE: Mandatory

parameters.name: cardId
parameters.description: Unique ID for current card. minLength: 1, maxLength: 50.

parameters.name: correlation-id
parameters.description: Unique ID provided by caller that correlates to a specific message transmission. Used to easily find a message in the logs.

post.description:
This API enables you to look up a cardId using the card number and optionally, the expiration date. The cardId identifier is necessary to interact with numerous Card Services APIs. This API is for service providers who do not store card numbers and for 3rd parties who do not have access to the cardId.

If expiration date is included in the request, the response returns a value of True or False in the isTransactionAllowed field. This field can assist service providers that participate in 3-D Secure e-commerce authorization requests by checking card status prior to transaction authorization.

MLE: Mandatory

parameters.name: correlation-id
parameters.description: Unique ID provided by caller that correlates to a specific message transmission. Used to easily find a message in the logs.

get.description:
Use this API to retrieve tokens associated with a specific cardId, or cardId + last4PrimaryAccountNumber.

Among the details returned are tokenRequestorId and tokenReferenceId. These IDs are required to manage a token’s lifecycle via the Manage Token Lifecycle API. Use this API if you do not store tokenRequestorId and tokenReferenceId in your system.

MLE: Required

parameters.name: correlation-id
parameters.description: Unique ID provided by caller that correlates to a specific message transmission. Used to easily find a message in the logs.

parameters.name: cardId
parameters.description: Unique ID for current card. minLength: 1, maxLength: 50.

parameters.name: showFullPan
parameters.description: This query parameter defines whether the response will have full or masked PAN.

parameters.name: last4PrimaryAccountNumber
parameters.description: This query parameter allows you to retrieve tokens for an inactive PAN associated with the provided cardId.

Use this API to manage the lifecycle of a token. Use the tokenRequestorId and tokenReferenceId returned in the Retrieve Tokens by cardId API (if you do not store these IDs on your system).

Allowed actions include CALL_CENTER_ACTIVATION, SUSPEND, RESUME, DELETE, and actions related to binding devices.

MLE: Required

The POST method of this API was deprecated in January 2025. Clients should migrate to the PUT method of this API.

parameters.name: correlation-id
parameters.description: Unique ID provided by caller that correlates to a specific message transmission. Used to easily find a message in the logs.

parameters.name: cardId
parameters.description: Unique ID for current card. minLength: 1, maxLength: 50.

parameters.name: last4PrimaryAccountNumber
parameters.description: This query parameter allows you to retrieve tokens for an inactive PAN associated with the provided cardId.

put.description:
This API enables you to update the status of an account. DPS Forward business rules govern the allowable transitions from one account status to another.

Accounts can be closed even if they maintain a balance. However, to avoid residency fees, the account balance should be reduced to "0".

Closing an account does not remove the profileId, cardId, or accountId records.

See Account and Profile Management.

MLE: Optional

parameters.name: accountId
parameters.description: Unique ID for account. minLength: 1, maxLength: 50.

parameters.name: correlation-id
parameters.description: Unique ID provided by caller that correlates to a specific message transmission. Used to easily find a message in the logs.

put.description:
This API enables you to remove an authorization hold for a specific event that is tied to a processorTransactionId. A transaction can have a single event or multiple events during its lifecycle. If multiple events exist, this API will only release one specific event. Any remaining events will be released when the age-off or clearing processes occur. You must call this API each time you want to remove an auth hold for an event.

The basic logic of this API is:
• You send an API request to DPS Forward asking to remove a hold for a specific processorTransactionId.
• DPS Forward validates the hold and sends an ISO 20022 advice message to you to release the hold.
• You receive the ISO 20022 advice message with the hold management instruction to remove the hold.
• DPS Forward responds to the original API request indicating if the hold was successfully removed.

If no valid holds remain on the transaction, this API returns an error.

MLE: Mandatory

parameters.name: correlation-id
parameters.description: Unique ID provided by caller that correlates to a specific message transmission. Used to easily find a message in the logs.

parameters.name: processorTransactionId
parameters.description: Unique transaction ID, generated by Forward. ISO 20022 field body.tx.txId.CardIssrRefData.

get.description:
This API enables you to retrieve the history of actions performed on a profile. Users can opt to return all activity or restrict the results to a particular action type and/or date range.

MLE: Mandatory

parameters.name: correlation-id
parameters.description: Unique ID provided by caller that correlates to a specific message transmission. Used to easily find a message in the logs.

parameters.name: profileId
parameters.description: Unique ID, generated by Visa, associated with a specific profile. minLength: 1, maxLength: 50.

parameters.name: startDate
parameters.description: Start date in  YYYY-MM-DD format. Start time is the start of that date. The value is in UTC and the format is yyyy-MM-dd'T'hh:mm:ss.SSS'Z'. Example: 2020-09-13T23:30:52.123Z.

parameters.name: endDate
parameters.description: End date for range of transactions. The value is in UTC and the format is yyyy-MM-dd'T'hh:mm:ss.SSS'Z'.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Index of starting point in result set. Page starts at 1.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of records returned on a page. minLimit: > 1, maxLimit: 100.

parameters.name: actionTypes
parameters.description:
Returns the profile history with requested action types. Examples: 
ProfileUpdate,
ProfileStateChange,
ScanProof,
ProfileUpdateForCardholder,
NegativeFileHitFraudCaseNumber

get.description:
This API enables you to retrieve profile details for a specified profileId.

MLE: Mandatory

parameters.name: correlation-id
parameters.description: Unique ID provided by caller that correlates to a specific message transmission. Used to easily find a message in the logs.

parameters.name: profileId

get.description:
This API enables you to retrieve profile details for a specified profileId. Additionally, the response returns all accountIds, cardIds, programIds, and the last four digits of card numbers associated with the profile.

MLE: Mandatory

Version 1 was deprecated in January 2025. Clients should migrate to version 3.

parameters.name: correlation-id
parameters.description: Unique ID provided by caller that correlates to a specific message transmission. Used to easily find a message in the logs.

parameters.name: profileId
parameters.description: Unique ID, generated by Visa, associated with a specific profile. minLength: 1, maxLength: 50.

patch.description:
This API enables you to update an existing profile using the profileId.

Values populated in the request overwrite the values in the profile. Blanks and empty strings tell the system to empty (delete) the value for the corresponding field. To leave a field as is, omit its key value pair from the request.

MLE: Mandatory

post.description:
This API enables you to replace a physical card, digital card, or both. It accommodates the various card replacement scenarios (lost/stolen, or undelivered) as well as standard card reissuance needs. In card replacement, the cardId remains the same. The replacement card has the same card number as the current card except for these scenarios where a different card number is issued:
  • Replacements for lost/stolen cards
  • Replacements for undeliverable cards
The expiration date defaults to your configurations for card lifecycle unless explicitly specified in the request. If cardStockId, cardVendorId, collateralId, and shippingMethod fields are left blank, this API uses the configured default values you set during onboarding.

The stored shipping address in the profile is the default address where cards are shipped. Including a shipping address in the request overrides the default shipping address.

MLE: Mandatory

parameters.name: correlation-id
parameters.description: Unique ID provided by caller that correlates to a specific message transmission. Used to easily find a message in the logs.

parameters.name: cardId
parameters.description: Unique ID for current card. minLength: 1, maxLength: 50.

parameters.name: showFullPan
parameters.description: This query parameter defines whether the response will have full or masked PAN

get.description:
This API enables you to retrieve all card orders associated with a specific accountId.

The status returned in the response is for the card order status, not the current card status.

Profile information included in the response is current as of the date of the order and does not include updates or changes made since the order date.

If you need order history at the card level, use the Retrieve Order Details by cardId API, or the Retrieve Order Details by cardId and orderId API.

MLE: Mandatory

parameters.name: correlation-id
parameters.description: Unique ID provided by caller that correlates to a specific message transmission. Used to easily find a message in the logs.

parameters.name: accountId
parameters.description: Unique ID for account. minLength: 1, maxLength: 50.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Index of starting point in result set. Page starts at 1.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of records returned on a page. minLimit: > 1, maxLimit: 100.

parameters.name: showFullPan
parameters.description: This query parameter defines whether the response will have full or masked PAN

get.summary: Retrieve Order Details by accountId and orderId
get.description:
This API enables you to retrieve card order details associated with a specific accountId and orderId.

The status returned in the response is for the card order status, not the current card status.

Profile information included in the response is current as of the date of the order, and does not include updates or changes made since the order date.

If you need order history at the card level, use the Retrieve Order Details by cardId API, or the Retrieve Order Details by cardId and orderId API.

MLE: Mandatory

parameters.name: correlation-id
parameters.description: Unique ID provided by caller that correlates to a specific message transmission. Used to easily find a message in the logs.

parameters.name: accountId
parameters.description: Unique ID for account. minLength: 1, maxLength: 50.

parameters.name: orderId
parameters.description: Unique ID for card orders.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Index of starting point in result set. Page starts at 1.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of records returned on a page. minLimit: > 1, maxLimit: 100.

parameters.name: showFullPan
parameters.description: This query parameter defines whether the response will have full or masked PAN

get.description:
This API enables you to retrieve the Wire Confirmation Report.

If you have multiple programs with different points of settlement, you can include an identifier for each point of settlement. The prcId is the id for the point of settlement. A prcId is a string that is 6 characters in length.

If you have multiple identifiers and want to filter on a particular one, you can include that prcId in the request. To return totals for all your points of settlement, leave the prcId blank.

If a date is not included in the request, this API returns the most recent Wire Confirmation Report.

Data will not be returned on days when a report is not generated.

MLE: Optional

parameters.name: correlation-id
parameters.description: Unique ID provided by caller that correlates to a specific message transmission. Used to easily find a message in the logs.

parameters.name: date
parameters.description: Settlement date in YYYY-MM-DD format. If not provided, then current date will be used.

parameters.name: prc
parameters.description: If PRC is provided, then report will only include the details related to the requested PRC. If not, then API will send response to all the PRC mapped to the sponsor.

This API enables you to retrieve account details for a specified accountId. Additionally, the response returns any profileIds, cardIds, programIds, and card numbers associated with the account.

MLE: Mandatory

parameters.name: accountId
parameters.description: Unique ID for account. minLength: 1, maxLength: 50.

parameters.name: correlation-id
parameters.description: Unique ID provided by caller that correlates to a specific message transmission. Used to easily find a message in the logs.

get.description:
This API enables you to retrieve the history of actions performed on an account. Users can opt to return all activity or restrict the results to a particular action type and/or date range.

MLE: Mandatory

parameters.name: correlation-id
parameters.description: Unique ID provided by caller that correlates to a specific message transmission. Used to easily find a message in the logs.

parameters.name: accountId
parameters.description: Unique ID for account. minLength: 1, maxLength: 50.

parameters.name: startDate
parameters.description: Start date in  YYYY-MM-DD format. Start time is the start of that date. The value is in UTC and the format is yyyy-MM-dd'T'hh:mm:ss.SSS'Z'. Example: 2020-09-13T23:30:52.123Z.

parameters.name: endDate
parameters.description: End date for range of transactions. The value is in UTC and the format is yyyy-MM-dd'T'hh:mm:ss.SSS'Z'.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Index of starting point in result set. Page starts at 1.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of records returned on a page. minLimit: > 1, maxLimit: 100.

parameters.name: actionTypes
parameters.description:
Returns the account history with requested action types. Examples: 
DelayedActivationBySystem,
AccountStatusUpdate,
BalanceSync

put.summary: Synchronize Balance with System of Record
put.description:
This API enables you to update actual (ledger) and available balances on the DPS Forward platform any time the host system processes a balance change for a specific account. Balance synchronization is only relevant for service providers who use account balances to authorize transactions during stand-in processing. You should include any activity that has occurred on the account that was not processed through DPS Forward, for example ACH and load network activity.

To update the balance, the account can be in any status. DPS Forward does not require that an account have a balance of "0" to close. Both positive and negative balance values are allowed.

If either one of the following conditions is true, the Balance Sync request is denied:

• Last balance date/timestamp, if provided, precedes the date/timestamp of the current Balance Sync request
• The consensusToken, if provided, does not match the account’s last financial consensus token on the DPS Forward system

MLE: Optional

idempotentId.description: GUID. Unique ID for this request. In case of any system failure or retry events, the client is expected to pass the same ID. This ID instructs the system to execute this operation one, and only one, time.

EntityHistoryResponse.description: Response object that contains details for this resource.

token.description: The account number associated with a token.

autoFillIndicator.description: Indicates whether the token is for an autofill use case.

originalTokenType.description: Token type of the original token.

tokenActivationDate.description: System date/timestamp, in GMT, of token activation into an active state.

tokenAssuranceMethod.description: Method of Issuer ID&V that has taken place at time of provisioning, device binding, or cardholder initiated verification.

originalTokenReferenceId.description: Unique ID for the token associated with the PAN. This ID can be used in lieu of the token for subsequent calls, such as life cycle events.

originalTokenRequestorId.description: Unique ID assigned to the initiator of the token request.

lastTokenStatusUpdatedTime.description: Date/timestamp, in GMT, of the last token status update.

numberOfActiveTokensForPan.description: Number of device tokens that are currently active for this PAN

numberOfInactiveTokensForPan.description: Number of device tokens that are currently inactive (device tokens have not been activated) for this PAN.

numberOfSuspendedTokensForPan.description: Number of device tokens that were activated, but are suspended for payments for this PAN.

TokenInfo.description: Token information, which includes all fields that are available.
